title: model: scikit: Classification models produce int64 types causes JSONEncoder to fail
body:
```
echo -e 'Clump_Thickness,Uniformity_of_Cell_Size,Uniformity_of_Cell_Shape,Marginal_Adhesion,Single_Epithelial_Cell_Size,Bare_Nuclei,Bland_Chromatin,Normal_Nucleoli,Mitoses,Class\n5,3,3,3,6,10,3,1,1 \n' | \
>   dffml predict all \
>     -model scikitsvc \
>      -model-features def:Clump_Thickness:int:1 def:Uniformity_of_Cell_Size:int:1 def:Uniformity_of_Cell_Shape:int:1 def:Marginal_Adhesion:int:1 def:Single_Epithelial_Cell_Size:int:1 def:Bare_Nuclei:int:1 def:Bland_Chromatin:int:1 def:Normal_Nucleoli:int:1 def:Mitoses:int:1 \
>         -model-predict Class \
>     -sources f=csv \
>     -source-filename /dev/stdin \
>     -source-readonly \
>     -log debug
```

```
[
    {
        "extra": {},
        "features": {
            "Bare_Nuclei": 10,
            "Bland_Chromatin": 3,
            "Class": null,
            "Clump_Thickness": 5,
            "Marginal_Adhesion": 3,
            "Mitoses": 1,
            "Normal_Nucleoli": 1,
            "Single_Epithelial_Cell_Size": 6,
            "Uniformity_of_Cell_Shape": 3,
            "Uniformity_of_Cell_Size": 3
        },
        "last_updated": "2019-12-10T22:10:28Z",
        "prediction": {
            "confidence": 1.0,
            "value": Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/bin/dffml", line 11, in <module>
    load_entry_point('dffml', 'console_scripts', 'dffml')()
  File "/home/tron/Desktop/dffml/dffml/util/cli/cmd.py", line 190, in main
    cls=cls.JSONEncoder,
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/json/__init__.py", line 179, in dump
    for chunk in iterable:
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 429, in _iterencode
    yield from _iterencode_list(o, _current_indent_level)
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 325, in _iterencode_list
    yield from chunks
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 439, in _iterencode
    yield from _iterencode(o, _current_indent_level)
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 431, in _iterencode
    yield from _iterencode_dict(o, _current_indent_level)
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 405, in _iterencode_dict
    yield from chunks
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 405, in _iterencode_dict
    yield from chunks
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 438, in _iterencode
    o = _default(o)
  File "/home/tron/Desktop/dffml/dffml/util/cli/cmd.py", line 45, in default
    return json.JSONEncoder.default(self, obj)
  File "/home/tron/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 179, in default
    raise TypeError(f'Object of type {o.__class__.__name__} '
TypeError: Object of type int64 is not JSON serializable
```
